job description:
As a Data Scientist, you will focus on improving and deepening
the level of understanding of our reader behavior. Your goal will
be to extract meaning from the data and advise our editorial and
development teams on your findings. You look to tell a story
based on your findings to assist in developing the product road
map to customize our content to better suit our reader. This
position will bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to
the challenges of measuring and understanding the behavior of the
40 million+ women that shop and consume content every month.

As a Data Scientist, you will:
  • Research, develop, and apply methods for measuring and
analyzing the performance of the media site and targeted email
products.
  • Develop new algorithms and methods for optimizing content
performance, revenue, and adoption.
  • Research new ways for modeling and predicting reader
behavior.
  • Lead investigations streams of content usage and A/B testing.
Advise product team on new features and modules based on
findings.
  • Design experiments and models to answer targeted questions.
Requirements:
  • At least 4 years of hands-on experience working with large
data sets.
  • Minimum of a BS in a quantitative discipline such as
Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics,
etc.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in SQL, SAS, Matlab, or R.
  • Comfortable writing code in python, ruby, perl, or equivalent
scripting language.
  • Ability to understand business problems, draw conclusions
from data and recommend actions on how best to solve these
problems.
  • Demonstrated self-direction.
Nice to Haves:
  • Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Scala, MySQL, Redshift and
other Amazon AWS
